info.name: Code Template
info.description: This is the collection that includes interactions with code templates that are not related to the code object that is related to the code templates. For ways to interact/affect the direct code objects, whether if they're associated with the code template or not, please visit the Code Execution collection.

item.name: Creation

request.description:
## Create code template tags

`POST /api/codeTemplate/createTags`

This endpoint allows you to create new tags for code templates.

### Request Body

- **tag** (string, required): The name of the tag to be created.
    

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "id": 1,
    "tag": "educational"
}

 ```

exec: // Check if accessToken exists in environment variables
// Set the Authorization header to use Bearer token from accessToken variable
// Check if refreshToken exists in environment variables
// Set the Refresh-Token header to use the refreshToken variable

request.description:
### Create code template

`POST /api/codeTemplate/create`

This endpoint allows an authenticated user to create a new code template.

#### Request Body

- `title` (string, required): The title of the code template.
    
- `explanation` (string, required): A brief explanation of the code template.
    
- `language` (string, required): The programming language of the code template.
    
- `tags` (array of strings, optional): The tags associated with the code template.
    

### Headers

- `Authorization` (string, required): Bearer token for access authorization
    
- `Refresh-Token` (string, required): Refresh token for access authorization
    

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "templateId": 1,
    "userId": 2,
    "title": "my first code template",
    "explanation": "adding 10 + 5 in python",
    "codeId": null,
    "language": "python",
    "isDeleted": false,
    "isHidden": false,
    "createdAt": "2024-11-05T00:04:19.491Z"
}

 ```

exec: // Check if accessToken exists in environment variables

request.description:
## Fork code template

`Post /api/codeTemplate/fork`

This endpoint allows an authenticated user to fork an existing code template.

### Request Query Parameters

- `codeTemplateId` (number, required): Code template to be forked.
    

### Headers

- `Authorization` (string, required): Bearer token for access authorization
    
- `Refresh-Token` (string, required): Refresh token for access authorization
    

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "templateId": 2,
    "userId": 1,
    "title": "my first code template",
    "explanation": "adding 10 + 5 in python",
    "codeId": null,
    "language": "python",
    "isDeleted": false,
    "isHidden": false,
    "createdAt": "2024-11-05T00:13:09.760Z"
}

 ```

item.description: This folder contains endpoints for creating a code template tag (typically used to initialize the tag bank), creating a brand new code template, and forking an existing code template.

request.description:
### Edit Code Template

`EDIT /api/codeTemplate/edit`

This endpoint allows an authenticated user to edit their own existing code template.

### Request Query Params

- `codeTemplateId` (number, required): The code template to be editted
    

#### Request Body

The body must include at least one of:

- `title` (string, optional): The updated title of the code template.
    
- `explanation` (string, optional): The updated explanation for the code template.
    
- `tags` (string, optional): An array of updated tags associated with the code template. **Tags must be created already to be used in updating a code template.**
    

### Headers

- `Authorization` (string, required): Bearer token for access authorization
    
- `Refresh-Token` (string, required): Refresh token for access authorization
    

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "templateId": 1,
    "userId": 1,
    "title": "my first edited code template!",
    "explanation": "Learn how to add 10 + 5 in Python!",
    "codeId": null,
    "language": "python",
    "isDeleted": false,
    "isHidden": true,
    "createdAt": "2024-11-03T20:14:00.314Z"
}

 ```

exec: // Check if accessToken exists in environment variables

request.description:
## Delete Code Template

`DELETE /api/codeTemplate/delete`

This endpoint allows authenticated users to to delete their own code template.

### Request Query Params

- `codeTemplateId` (number, required): Code template to be deleted
    

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "templateId": 2,
    "userId": 1,
    "title": "my first edited code template!",
    "explanation": "this has been edited",
    "codeId": null,
    "language": "python",
    "isDeleted": true,
    "isHidden": false,
    "createdAt": "2024-11-05T00:13:09.760Z"
}

 ```

## View specific code template

`GET /api/codeTemplate/[id]`

This endpoint allows any user to retrieve a code template with the specified ID.

### Request Params

- `id` (required): Code template to be viewed.
    

### Request Body

No request body is required for this endpoint.

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "templateId": 2,
    "userId": 1,
    "title": "my first edited code template!",
    "explanation": "this has been edited",
    "codeId": null,
    "language": "python",
    "isDeleted": true,
    "isHidden": false,
    "createdAt": "2024-11-05T00:13:09.760Z"
}

 ```

item.name: Search code templates based on optional criterion

request.description:
## Search all available code templates

`GET /api/codeTemplate/searchAll`

This endpoint allows any user to retrieve a paginated list of code templates that are not hidden or deleted according to their search criterion.

### Request Body

- `searchTitle` (string, optional): Filters code templates by title.
    
- `searchExplanation` (string, optional): Filters templates based on explanation content.
    
- `searchLanguage` (string, optional): Filters templates by programming language.
    
- `searchTags` (array of strings, optional): Filters templates based on associated tags.
    
- `page` (integer, optional, default = 1): Specifies the pagination page.
    
- `pageSize` (integer, optional, default = 10): Specifies the number of items per page.
    

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "data": [
        {
            "templateId": 1,
            "userId": 2,
            "title": "my first code template",
            "explanation": "adding 10 + 5 in python",
            "codeId": null,
            "language": "python",
            "isDeleted": false,
            "isHidden": false,
            "createdAt": "2024-11-05T00:04:19.491Z"
        }
    ],
    "currentPage": 1,
    "totalPages": 1,
    "totalTemplates": 1
}
 ```

request.description:
## Search your own code templates

`GET /api/codeTemplate/searchUser`

This endpoint retrieves user-authenticated-specific code templates based on the provided search criteria.

### Request Body

- `userId` (integer, required): ID of the user whose templates are being requested; must match the authenticated userâ€™s ID.
    
- `searchTitle` (string, optional): Searches templates by title.
    
- `searchExplanation` (string, optional): Searches templates by explanation content.
    
- `searchLanguage` (string, optional): Filters by programming language.
    
- `searchTags` (array of strings, optional): Filters by associated tags.
    
- `page` (integer, optional, default = 1): Specifies the pagination page.
    
- `pageSize` (integer, optional, default = 10): Specifies the number of items per page.
    

### Headers

- `Authorization` (string, required): Bearer token for access authorization
    
- `Refresh-Token` (string, required): Refresh token for access authorization
    

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "data": [
        {
            "templateId": 1,
            "userId": 2,
            "title": "my first code template",
            "explanation": "adding 10 + 5 in python",
            "codeId": null,
            "language": "python",
            "isDeleted": false,
            "isHidden": false,
            "createdAt": "2024-11-05T00:04:19.491Z"
        }
    ],
    "currentPage": 1,
    "totalPages": 1,
    "totalTemplates": 1
}

 ```

request.description:
## Report a code template

`POST /api/codeTemplate/report`

This endpoint allows an authenticated user to report a code template.

### Request Body

- `codeTemplateId` (number, required) - The ID of the code template being reported.
    
- `body` (string, required) - The reason for reporting the code template.
    
- `contentType` (string, required) - The type of content being reported (e.g., "code template").
    

### Headers

- `Authorization` (string, required): Bearer token for access authorization
    
- `Refresh-Token` (string, required): Refresh token for access authorization
    

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "reportId": 5,
    "userId": 1,
    "body": "inappropriate",
    "isResolved": false,
    "contentType": "code template",
    "createdAt": "2024-11-05T00:44:12.316Z",
    "blogPostId": null,
    "commentId": null,
    "codeTemplateId": 1
}

 ```

exec: // Check if accessToken exists in environment variables
// Set the Authorization header to use Bearer token from accessToken variable
// Check if refreshToken exists in environment variables
// Set the Refresh-Token header to use the refreshToken variable

request.description:
## Search code template reports

`GET /api/codeTemplate/admin/searchReports`

This endpoint retrieves code template reports for admin users.

### Request Body

- `searchCodeTemplateId` (number, optional): Filters by a specifc code template.
    
- `searchUserId` (number, optional): Filters by a specific user ID.
    
- `searchUnresolved` (boolean, optional): If true, filters by unresolved reports.
    
- `page` (number, optional, default = 1): Pagination page.
    
- `pageSize` (number, optional, default = 10): Number of code templates per page.
    

### Headers

- `Authorization` (string, required): Bearer token for access authorization
    
- `Refresh-Token` (string, required): Refresh token for access authorization
    

### Example Response

``` json
[
    {
        "reportId": 5,
        "userId": 1,
        "body": "inappropriate",
        "isResolved": false,
        "contentType": "code template",
        "createdAt": "2024-11-05T00:44:12.316Z",
        "blogPostId": null,
        "commentId": null,
        "codeTemplateId": 1
    },
    {
        "reportId": 6,
        "userId": 3,
        "body": "ew",
        "isResolved": false,
        "contentType": "code template",
        "createdAt": "2024-11-05T00:46:53.250Z",
        "blogPostId": null,
        "commentId": null,
        "codeTemplateId": 1
    }
]

 ```

request.description:
## Resolve Reports

`POST /api/codeTemplate/admin/resolveReports`

This endpoint allows an admin user to resolve reports by providing the code template ID and report ID.

### **Request Body**

- `codeTemplateId` (number, required) - The ID of the code template.
    
- `reportId` (number. required) - The ID of the report to be resolved.
    

### Headers

- `Authorization` (string, required): Bearer token for access authorization
    
- `Refresh-Token` (string, required): Refresh token for access authorization
    

### **Example Response**

``` json
{
    "reportId": 6,
    "userId": 3,
    "body": "ew",
    "isResolved": true,
    "contentType": "code template",
    "createdAt": "2024-11-05T00:46:53.250Z",
    "blogPostId": null,
    "commentId": null,
    "codeTemplateId": 1
}

 ```

request.description:
## Hide Code Template

`POST /api/codeTemplate/admin/hide`

This endpoint allows the admin to hide a code template.

### Request Body

- `codeTemplateId` (number, required): The ID of the code template to be hidden.
    
- `wantHidden` (boolean, required): Indicates whether the code template should be hidden.
    

### Headers

- `Authorization` (string, required): Bearer token for access authorization
    
- `Refresh-Token` (string, required): Refresh token for access authorization
    

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "templateId": 1,
    "userId": 2,
    "title": "my first code template",
    "explanation": "adding 10 + 5 in python",
    "codeId": null,
    "language": "python",
    "isDeleted": false,
    "isHidden": true,
    "createdAt": "2024-11-05T00:04:19.491Z"
}

 ```
